001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.util.datalog;
006
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.io.RandomAccessFile;
009import java.nio.BufferUnderflowException;
010import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
011import java.nio.ByteOrder;
012import java.nio.MappedByteBuffer;
013import java.nio.channels.FileChannel;
014import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
015import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
016import java.util.function.Consumer;
017
018/** Data log reader (reads logs written by the DataLog class). */
019public class DataLogReader implements Iterable<DataLogRecord> {
020  /**
021   * Constructs from a byte buffer.
022   *
023   * @param buffer byte buffer
024   */
025  public DataLogReader(ByteBuffer buffer) {
026    m_buf = buffer;
027    m_buf.order(ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN);
028  }
029
030  /**
031   * Constructs from a file.
032   *
033   * @param filename filename
034   * @throws IOException if could not open/read file
035   */
036  public DataLogReader(String filename) throws IOException {
037    RandomAccessFile f = new RandomAccessFile(filename, "r");
038    FileChannel channel = f.getChannel();
039    MappedByteBuffer buf = channel.map(FileChannel.MapMode.READ_ONLY, 0, channel.size());
040    m_buf = buf;
041    m_buf.order(ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN);
042    channel.close();
043    f.close();
044  }
045
046  /**
047   * Returns true if the data log is valid (e.g. has a valid header).
048   *
049   * @return True if valid, false otherwise
050   */
051  public boolean isValid() {
052    return m_buf.remaining() >= 12
053        && m_buf.get(0) == 'W'
054        && m_buf.get(1) == 'P'
055        && m_buf.get(2) == 'I'
056        && m_buf.get(3) == 'L'
057        && m_buf.get(4) == 'O'
058        && m_buf.get(5) == 'G'
059        && m_buf.getShort(6) >= 0x0100;
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Gets the data log version. Returns 0 if data log is invalid.
064   *
065   * @return Version number; most significant byte is major, least significant is minor (so version
066   *     1.0 will be 0x0100)
067   */
068  public short getVersion() {
069    if (m_buf.remaining() < 12) {
070      return 0;
071    }
072    return m_buf.getShort(6);
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Gets the extra header data.
077   *
078   * @return Extra header data
079   */
080  public String getExtraHeader() {
081    ByteBuffer buf = m_buf.duplicate();
082    buf.order(ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN);
083    buf.position(8);
084    int size = buf.getInt();
085    byte[] arr = new byte[size];
086    buf.get(arr);
087    return new String(arr, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
088  }
089
090  @Override
091  public void forEach(Consumer<? super DataLogRecord> action) {
092    int size = m_buf.remaining();
093    for (int pos = 12 + m_buf.getInt(8); pos < size; pos = getNextRecord(pos)) {
094      DataLogRecord record;
095      try {
096        record = getRecord(pos);
097      } catch (NoSuchElementException ex) {
098        break;
099      }
100      action.accept(record);
101    }
102  }
103
104  @Override
105  public DataLogIterator iterator() {
106    return new DataLogIterator(this, 12 + m_buf.getInt(8));
107  }
108
109  private long readVarInt(int pos, int len) {
110    long val = 0;
111    for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
112      val |= ((long) (m_buf.get(pos + i) & 0xff)) << (i * 8);
113    }
114    return val;
115  }
116
117  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.PreserveStackTrace")
118  DataLogRecord getRecord(int pos) {
119    try {
120      int lenbyte = m_buf.get(pos) & 0xff;
121      int entryLen = (lenbyte & 0x3) + 1;
122      int sizeLen = ((lenbyte >> 2) & 0x3) + 1;
123      int timestampLen = ((lenbyte >> 4) & 0x7) + 1;
124      int headerLen = 1 + entryLen + sizeLen + timestampLen;
125      int entry = (int) readVarInt(pos + 1, entryLen);
126      int size = (int) readVarInt(pos + 1 + entryLen, sizeLen);
127      long timestamp = readVarInt(pos + 1 + entryLen + sizeLen, timestampLen);
128      // build a slice of the data contents
129      ByteBuffer data = m_buf.duplicate();
130      data.position(pos + headerLen);
131      data.limit(pos + headerLen + size);
132      return new DataLogRecord(entry, timestamp, data.slice());
133    } catch (BufferUnderflowException | IndexOutOfBoundsException ex) {
134      throw new NoSuchElementException();
135    }
136  }
137
138  int getNextRecord(int pos) {
139    int lenbyte = m_buf.get(pos) & 0xff;
140    int entryLen = (lenbyte & 0x3) + 1;
141    int sizeLen = ((lenbyte >> 2) & 0x3) + 1;
142    int timestampLen = ((lenbyte >> 4) & 0x7) + 1;
143    int headerLen = 1 + entryLen + sizeLen + timestampLen;
144
145    int size = 0;
146    for (int i = 0; i < sizeLen; i++) {
147      size |= (m_buf.get(pos + 1 + entryLen + i) & 0xff) << (i * 8);
148    }
149    return pos + headerLen + size;
150  }
151
152  int size() {
153    return m_buf.remaining();
154  }
155
156  private final ByteBuffer m_buf;
157}
